hackathon-description-text: Taking place from the 30th to the 31st of January 2016, the first large hackathon in Cambridge is bound to be a lot fun. 400 attendees will descend upon one of the world's oldest universities, some coming from as far as MIT, Singapore, and Egypt. Students from all over the world are welcome!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Senior Lecturer in the Computer Laboratory at the University of Cambridge
Principal Product Manager at Amazon (Echo, Alexa and Evi)
Full Professor of Mobile Systems in the Computer Laboratory at the University of Cambridge

hackathon-rules: Participants will have to adher to MLH's code of conduct - http://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: £200 Amazon vouchers for each member of the winning team.
Early access to SpatialOS and Improbable printed Oculus Gear VR kits.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack in Gaming/Virtual Reality by Improbable

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: For each member of the winning team: Grover Sensor starter kit for mbed, ROCKI wifi music system, and a £30 Spotify gift card.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack in Hardware by ARM
Best use of HPE Haven OnDemand API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One Parrot Jumping Race Drone JETT for each member of the winning team.
£1000 pounds in gift cards split amongst the winning team.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Amazon Web Services

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: £1000 in Cloud Platform credit to continue your idea after the hackathon.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Google Cloud Platform
Best domain name registered with Domain.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: £100 Amazon voucher for each member of the winning team.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2 Wheeler St, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire CB2 3QB, UK
hackathon-location-address: 2 Wheeler St, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire CB2 3QB, UK
hackathon-description-header: The University of Cambridge's very own hackathon!
